column2: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings.
column5: The renovation of buildings can lead to an increased demand for recycled materials, such as lithium, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 50% of lithium by 2027. This is because building renovation can generate waste that can be recycled, contributing to the overall recycling rate of lithium.

column2: The amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030
column5: The increased use of renewable fuels in the transport sector can lead to a higher demand for recycled materials in packaging, such as plastic, which can positively impact the target of having at least 30% of plastic packaging be recyclable by 2025.

column2: Each Member State shall increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector by at least 0.8 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2025 and by at least 1.1 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2026 to 2030
column5: The increased use of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector can lead to a decrease in the demand for lightweight plastic carrier bags, which can negatively impact the target of reducing the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year, when compared to 2021
column5: The reduction of energy consumption in public bodies can lead to a decrease in food waste generation, which can positively impact the target of reducing food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% by 2025.

column2: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of renewable sources in the amount of energy sources used for final energy and non-energy purposes in the industry sector by an indicative increase of at least 1.6 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the periods 2021 to 2025 and 2026 to 2030
column5: The increased use of renewable energy in the industry sector can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, which can positively impact the target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions from waste management.

column2: A target of 15% electricity interconnection for 2030
column5: The increased interconnection of electricity can lead to an increased demand for raw materials, such as copper, which can negatively impact the target of recycling at least 50% of ferrous metals by 2025.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year, when compared to 2021
column5: The reduction of energy consumption in public bodies can lead to a decrease in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 65% of all packaging waste by 2025.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario
column5: The reduction of energy consumption can lead to a decrease in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 50% of plastic by 2025.

column2: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030
column5: The reduction of primary energy consumption can lead to a decrease in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 25% of wood by 2025.

column2: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings
column5: The renovation of buildings can lead to an increased demand for recycled materials, such as glass, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 70% of glass by 2025.

column2: Reduce buildings’ final energy consumption by 14%
column5: The reduction of energy consumption in buildings can lead to a decrease in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 50% of aluminium by 2025.

column2: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030
column5: The increased renovation rate of buildings can lead to an increased demand for recycled materials, such as paper and cardboard, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 75% of paper and cardboard by 2025.

column2: Reduce buildings’ energy consumption for heating and cooling by 18% compared to 2015 levels by 2030
column5: The reduction of energy consumption in buildings can lead to a decrease in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 50% of plastic by 2025.

column2: Member states will have to renovate 16% of worst-performing non-residential buildings by 2030
column5: The renovation of non-residential buildings can lead to an increased demand for recycled materials, such as construction waste, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 65% of all packaging waste by 2025.

column2: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings.
column5: The renovation of buildings can lead to an increased demand for recycled materials, such as lithium, which can positively impact the target of recycling at least 50% of lithium by 2027.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030
column5: The reduction of energy consumption in residential buildings can lead to a decrease in the demand for lightweight plastic carrier bags, which can negatively impact the target of reducing the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags.

column2: Member States are required to achieve cumulative end-use energy savings from 2021 to 2030
column5: The reduction of energy consumption can lead to a decrease in food waste generation, which can positively impact the target of reducing food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% by 2025.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials, 50% for lithium
column5: The increased recycling of lithium can lead to a reduction in the demand for primary lithium, which can positively impact the target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions from the energy sector.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10%
column5: The reduction of food waste can lead to a decrease in energy consumption, which can positively impact the target of reducing energy consumption in public bodies.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita
column5: The reduction of food waste can lead to a decrease in energy consumption, which can positively impact the target of increasing the share of renewable sources in the industry sector.

column2: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content
column5: The increased use of recycled content in packaging can lead to an increased demand for raw materials, such as copper, which can negatively impact the target of achieving 15% electricity interconnection by 2030.

column2: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags
column5: The reduction of lightweight plastic carrier bags can lead to a decrease in the demand for recycled materials, which can negatively impact the target of recycling at least 65% of all packaging waste by 2025.

column2: Each vehicle belonging to a vehicle type that is type-approved as of the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of this Regulation
column5: The increased recycling of vehicles can lead to an increased demand for raw materials, such as steel, which can negatively impact the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain the recycling targets of 65% by weight
column5: The increased recycling of packaging waste can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of reducing primary energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of plastic
column5: The increased recycling of plastic can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of renovating at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings each year.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 25% of wood
column5: The increased recycling of wood can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of reducing buildings' final energy consumption by 14%.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of ferrous metals
column5: The increased recycling of ferrous metals can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of doubling the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of aluminium
column5: The increased recycling of aluminium can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of reducing buildings' energy consumption for heating and cooling by 18% compared to 2015 levels by 2030.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of glass
column5: The increased recycling of glass can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of renovating 16% of worst-performing non-residential buildings by 2030.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 75% of paper and cardboard
column5: The increased recycling of paper and cardboard can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of ensuring that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings.

column2: Each vehicle belonging to a vehicle type that is type-approved as of the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of this Regulation
column5: The increased recycling of vehicles can lead to an increased demand for raw materials, such as steel, which can negatively impact the target of ensuring that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030.

column2: The plastic contained in each vehicle type that is type-approved as of the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of the Regulation
column5: The increased recycling of plastic from vehicles can lead to a reduction in waste generation, which can positively impact the target of achieving cumulative end-use energy savings from 2021 to 2030.
